Package ooga.model.components.moves

Class FiniteSlide

java.lang.Object
ooga.model.components.moves.PieceMovement
ooga.model.components.moves.FiniteSlide
public class FiniteSlide
extends PieceMovement
This movement class represents a move that can travel an finite number of spaces in a certain direction. However, it cannot travel through other pieces because it slides.

The implementation of this class makes the assumption that finite slide moves will be in either a diagonal direction, or horizontal/vertical. This is because anything other than these cases makes it unclear what path the piece takes, making it unworkable with the current information that the class gets

      Parameters:
      parameters - The parameters of the move
      direction - 1 if going up, -1 if going down. Used to adjust parameters for different sides of the board

  • Method Details

    • getAllPossibleMoves

      public java.util.List<Coordinate> getAllPossibleMoves​(Coordinate coordinates, GameBoard board, java.lang.String teamName)
      Gets all the possible moves associated with this finiteSlide movement object. Will be a single set of coordinates or no coordinates if it can take pieces, because it will simply slide until it is able to take a piece. Can be zero or more sets of coordinates if not, because it will slide until a piece gets in its way or it reaches the edge of the board or the end of it's sliding distance. The coordinate object passed into this method is altered, because in theory it should be passed from the front end but not used for anything else besides this method
      Specified by:
      getAllPossibleMoves in class PieceMovement
      Parameters:
      coordinates - The coordinates of the piece that this move is acting on
      board - The board that this piece is on
      teamName - The name of the team of this piece
      Returns:
      A list of the coordinates of possible moves
